text:
Ten terrific things to do in Dingle Published on : Friday, October 9, 2015
Named by TripAdvisor as Ireland’s Best Small Hotel 2014 and 2015 and Best Bargain Hotel in the World 2014, the hotel overlooks the famous Dingle Bay, home of Fungi the dolphin.
To celebrate its decade in business, Castlewood House has created a list of Ten Terrific Things to do in Dingle, packaging them with its award-winning accommodation to offer a fantastic value for money short break.
The package includes two nights accommodation in a Bayview Room, a bottle of pink Champagne, a bouquet of roses, handmade Dingle Gin Truffles and a private breakfast in the drawing room overlooking Dingle Bay.
Running from October 2015 to April 2016, this is one to grab – choose one of these Ten Terrific Things to Do in Dingle as part of the package.
Castlewood House vintage afternoon tea
The hotel loves to offer this treat, which is served in our drawing room overlooking the bay. It includes a selection of finger sandwiches including Ted Browne’s organic smoked salmon, homemade sweet scones and a selection of pastries all served on a collection of vintage crockery.
Wild Atlantic seaweed baths and spa
Take a one hour seaweed bath in the newly opened spa in Ballydavid, located 25 minutes drive from Dingle. It uses fresh seaweed harvested from the shores of Baile na Gall.
Private one hour cruise on Dingle Bay
It’s really lovely to have the private hire of one of the pleasure boats that depart from Dingle Marina. The cruise will take you out past the sea caves and out to the mouth of Dingle Bay where you can enjoy the vista out to the Atlantic Ocean. Who knows, you might just spot Fungi.
Private tour of Dingle Distillery
The Dingle Distillery is just 100 yards away from Castlewood House. Enjoy a private guided tour through the history of whiskey making in Ireland, the whiskey making process and culminating in sampling the excellent Dingle Whiskey, Dingle Gin and Dingle Distillery Vodka.
Cookery lesson in Dingle Cookery School
Dingle Cookery School is just 200 yards from Castlewood House and offers a huge range of lessons for cooks of all levels. They use the best of local produce and you will end your half-day lesson with a dish to enjoy, and all course materials to take home to continue creating fantastic food at home.
Private demonstration in Dingle Crystal
This is a workshop with master craftsman Sean Daly, who learned his craft in the Waterford Crystal factory where he worked for many years before starting his own business in Dingle. Sean’s creative and exclusive designs all begin life in his own workshop on the Dingle peninsula and he will give you a hands on tutorial lasting approximately one hour.
Two-hour kayak with Dingle Adventures
Taking in sea caves, this is a brilliant morning or afternoon activity and you will get to experience the rugged beauty of Dingle Bay up close and personal. An experienced guide will give you all the information of the wildlife and you will finish up out with Fungi the famous Dingle dolphin.
Ryan’s Daughter walk
Your own professional guide will take you on this most beautiful walk which will take two to three hours and takes in all the majestic sea coast beauty of the Dingle peninsula, enjoying the bird and sea life on the way. Castlewood House will send you off with a picnic basket full of Dingle produce including Tom Crean’s Beer and Dingle Dillisk Cheese.
Make your own pot with Louis Mulcahy Pottery
Make your own little memory to take away. Louis Mulcahy Pottery is a 25 minute drive away from Dingle on the most westerly point of the Dingle Peninsula. Here you will have a pottery lesson with an experienced potter and then your piece will be fired and delivered to your home in a few weeks.
Scenic two-hour horse-riding trek
This experience is for beginners in search of fun and a memorable introduction to riding, right through to expert riders looking for exciting and challenging rides in the open country on Dingle Peninsula. The Cnoc an Cairn mountain trek takes you into the hills behind Dingle with views of the Atlantic Ocean and its rugged off-shore islands. On the brow of the mountain the experienced riders are taken on the canter track while beginners continue on the scenic route
